intro: Lasiosiphon anthylloides var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
